text: Kenneth Joel "Kenny" Hotz (born May 3, 1967 in Toronto, Ontario) is a Canadian producer, writer, director actor, and comedian. He used to be a consultant and writer for South Park, the creator and star of both Kenny vs. Spenny and Kenny Hotz's Triumph of the Will, and the writer of Testees. Hotz has won many awards including Gemini Awards and Canadian Comedy Awards. He is also a Gulf War photo-journalist and an award-winning Vice writer. He owns The Hoxton and Dog & Bear restaurant and bars in Toronto, Canada. He is the Comedy Chair of the Banff World Media Festival Advisory Boards for the Banff World Media Festival and cofounded Aux Mode, an online content distribution and monetization firm in 2013. He currently hosts a weekly radio show with Sirius Radio in the U.S. ==Filmography== ===Movies=== *It Don't Cost Nothin' to Say Good Morning (1994) (Short movie) (Director, DOP, Editor) *Pitch - Himself (1997) (Creator, Executive Producer, Writer, Director, Actor) *The Papal Chase - Himself (2004) (Executive Producer, Writer, Director, Actor) *Zack and Miri Make a Porno - Zack #2 (2008) (Actor) *Degrassi Takes Manhattan - Cameo (2010) ===Television=== *Ninja Turtles: The Next Mutation (1997) (Writer) *Kenny vs. Spenny - Himself (2003-2010) (Creator, Executive Producer, Writer, Director, Actor) *South Park (2004â€“06, 2012) (Writer, Consultant) *Elton vs. Simon (2005) (Executive Producer) *Odd Job Jack - Clay Shogen (voice) (2007) *Testees - Larry (2008) (Creator, Executive Producer, Writer, Director, Actor) *Pure Pwnage - Cameo (2009) *Kenny vs. Spenny Christmas Special - Himself (2010) (Creator, Executive Producer, Writer, Director, Actor) *Kenny Hotz's Triumph of the Will - Himself (2011) (Executive Producer, Creator, Writer, Director, Actor) ==References== ==Other websites== *Official website * * Category:1967 births Category:Actors from Toronto Category:Atheists Category:Canadian bloggers Category:Canadian television actors Category:Canadian television producers Category:Canadian television writers Category:Comedians from Toronto Category:Jewish actors Category:Jewish writers Category:Living people Category:Writers from Toronto
